Package org.neo4j.ssl.config

Class SslPolicyLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.neo4j.ssl.config.SslPolicyLoader
  • public class SslPolicyLoader
extends Object
    Each component which utilises SSL policies is recommended to provide a component specific override setting for the name of the SSL policy to use. It is also recommended that this setting allows null to be specified with the meaning that no SSL security shall be put into place. What this means practically is up to the component, but it could for example mean that the traffic will be plaintext over TCP in such case.
    See Also:
    SslPolicy

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static SslPolicyLoader create​(Config config,
                                     LogProvider logProvider)
        Loads all the SSL policies as defined by the config.
        Parameters:
        config - The configuration for the SSL policies.
        Returns:
        A factory populated with SSL policies.

      • getPolicy

        public SslPolicy getPolicy​(SslPolicyScope scope)
        Use this for retrieving the SSL policy configured under the specified name.
        Parameters:
        scope - The scope of the SSL policy to be returned.
        Returns:
        Returns the policy defined under the requested name. If the policy name is null then the null policy will be returned which means that SSL will not be used. It is up to each respective SSL policy using component to decide exactly what that means.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If a policy with the supplied name does not exist.
